<!-- ⚠️ Do NOT edit this README! It is automatically generated by _build/update-readme.js. Edit README.src.md instead! -->
# prettier-plugin-space-before-function-paren

A prettier plugin to add a space before function parentheses for function definitions (but not function calls) in JS.
Requires Prettier 3.0.0 or later.

Current version is a proof of concept, please try it out and give feedback!

## Examples of what this plugin changes

### Function declaration



```js

function test(a, b) {
	return a + b;
}

```

becomes:

```js

function test (a, b) {
	return a + b;
}

```
### Class methods



```js

class Foo {
	method(a, b) {
		return a + b;
	}
}

```

becomes:

```js

class Foo {
	method (a, b) {
		return a + b;
	}
}

```
### Class getters



```js

class Foo {
	get method() {
		return true;
	}
}

```

becomes:

```js

class Foo {
	get method () {
		return true;
	}
}

```
### Class setters



```js

class Foo {
	set method() {
		return true;
	}
}

```

becomes:

```js

class Foo {
	set method () {
		return true;
	}
}

```

## Examples of what remains unchanged

### Function calls



```js

test(1, 2);

```

becomes:

```js

test(1, 2);

```
### Arrow function



```js

const add = (a, b) => a + b;

```

becomes:

```js

const add = (a, b) => a + b;

```
### Anonymous function

Prettier already handles this case.

```js

const add = function(a, b) {
	return a + b;
};

```

becomes:

```js

const add = function (a, b) {
	return a + b;
};

```
